name: Eight Epics
description: Eight Epics is a cooperative dice game in which the heroic players must overcome unprecedented crises through the powers available to them and the ability to roll dice. A hero's capacity for heroics is finite, however, so you need to prevent the disaster before you run out of life.

name: The Red Dragon's Lair
description:
The Red Dragon's Lair is a fantasy adventure in which you become a Magician, Rogue, Warrior or Paladin on a quest to slay an evil dragon. You control the actions of a daring adventurer finding the way through a dungeon filled with undead monsters, elementals and treacherous traps. In the mysterious creepy corridors of the dungeon your quest continues against the evil forces that oppose you. Your daring efforts to reach the Red Dragon's Lair is where your adventure begins and your quest awaits.

The evil Red Dragon lives deep within a dungeon filled with undead monsters and elementals. Your goal is to clear the dungeon of evil and slay the Red Dragon. You and the other players join together looting monsters and plundering the dungeon in search of magical items and weapons!

This game is a character-driven game, which uses both cards and dice to deal with the many obstacles within the dungeon and the Red Dragon's Lair. Players play cards from their hands and roll dice to complete their goal.

Players choose a character deck at the beginning of the game then equip their special items and weapons. Each character is unique and uses different styles of play. The crafty Rogue hides in the shadows firing arrows from a distance. The Paladin engages the monsters head-on with shield and sword. The Warrior jumps in the fray without regard for himself slaying monsters near and far. And the Magician uses powerful magic to protect the others and destroy monsters! The awesome forces that oppose you can prove to be more than a match and adventurers will die!

Working together players battle monsters and avoid traps on their way to the Red Dragon's Lair. If you slay the Red Dragon you win the game!

name: Sedmiměstí
description:
Game is played in the country "SedmimÄ›stí" ("Seven-cities"). There are six ordinary cities on the board and one magic - The seventh. Goal of the game is reach the magic city which is located on an island in the middle of the board. To get into the magic city you need to know names of three magic items.

It's a game of fun and parody, combining strategic games and RPG. Very quick game setup.

Box contents:
- 1 colorful board 60 x 60 cm in two variants
- 21 hero cards
- 25 fortune cards (magic items and beings)
- 33 encounter cards
- 3 six-sided dice
- 33 plastic card stands
- 1 list of magic items
- rules

name: Storm Hollow: A Storyboard Game
description:
Storm Hollow: A Storyboard Game is an amazing storytelling adventure game for all ages. One player assumes the role of the Storyteller, while the others are heroes called to the magical land of Storm Hollow to aid in a time of need.

Each game session provides a stand-alone adventure scenario with a specific story-driven goal for the players to try to accomplish, and multiple adventures can be strung together in campaign mode to experience fully interactive epic stories. Players work together to fight monsters, overcome obstacles, rescue characters, find lost treasures, and drive back the darkness using a simple skill-based system and unique heroic powers.

In Storm Hollow story is king, and a clever game system encourages creative decisions and amazing outcomes. Play pre-made adventures or use the numerous tools to make your own.

The box includes a "Battle for Storm Hollow" variant, which is a pure co-op game (no storyteller required).

name: Fantasy Food Truck
description:
What if you had a food truck in a fantasy world? In Fantasy Food Truck you get to live this out! Personalize it by naming your food truck, making a logo, and creating your menu. Level up your staff (Rogue, Artificer, Bard, Wizard, Ranger, and Barbarian) in order to better explore the surrounding area. Discover new customers (Gnomes, Goblins, Merfolk, Dwarves, Elves, and Orcs), defeat dangerous skeletons, tame wild dragons, and find hidden treasures. Earn the most stars to have the best fantasy food truck.

Fantasy Food Truck is a free print and play roll and write. It is all on one page and uses just four dice. Played over twelve rounds, you will advance tracks and also place polyominoes on the map. It can be played solo or up to 100+ players, all players will use the same dice rolls and see who can score the highest from those same rolls.

—description from designer

name: Dice Quest
description: Dice Quest is a pseudo fantasy role-playing game that was designed to have the minimum elements of an RPG, without being an actual RPG.  The game mechanics allow players to create their own RPG-style adventurers who possess a Character Class, Hit Points and Experience Points for leveling up.  Each pocket-sized game box includes 4 Specialty Dice, the game rules, a pad of Character Sheets and pad of graph paper for laying out the dungeon.  The four specialty dice included with Dice Quest substitute the need for a game moderator or "Dungeon Master" and allow players to create the labyrinth, encounter monsters, resolve combat and collect treasure while on their dungeon outing.

name: Thunder Under Mount Silence
description:
Only your courage and cunning stand between the city of Mount Silence and the savage horde rising from below. The fate of Gnome-kind lies in your hands.

Receive your mission briefing and delve into a shifting network of tunnels that changes every time you enter. A horde of goblins awaits, their actions driven by a narrative framework. You and your fellow gnomes must fight smart, strike fast, and survive. The delicate balance of the underworld can be tipped—but only if you restore it in time.

This is a tactical dungeon-crawler with brutal melee combat, positional gameplay, and risk management. Players control gnome miniatures, explore modular board tiles, and engage in dice-based combat. Red dice are for attacking, blue for defense, and stamina fuels your actions.

Combat is fast and decisive. Models move, interact, and Take a Swing—an attack action using Stamina and dice. Results range from damage to knockdowns, stamina recovery, or sweeping attacks. Weapons matter: axes cleave through multiple enemies, while spears and swords offer different tactical roles.

Enemies react through line of sight and scripted behaviors, creating dynamic solo or co-op experiences. Prone models can recover, but can’t defend until they do. Every decision counts.

Includes:

25 detailed metal miniatures
Modular dungeon tiles
Narrative-driven enemy AI
Unique weapon mechanics
Solo, Co-op, Versus & Team Modes (1–7 players)

Thunder Under Mount Silence delivers a gritty, immersive dungeon adventure with tactical depth and high replayability.

—description from the publisher

name: Karma Crystals: Block Master
description:
Karma Crystals - Block Master - (KC01)
Dice-To-Card Matches Get You Through Your Karma Travels!

You can travel through life with good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Block Master, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and give it to your opponents to get the win. Use your Karma Crystal to block other players from moving through the positive karma path and win!

This 1st entry into the Karma Crystals game collection introduces many of the mechanics we use in all our games, including the Roll Off, Karma Crystals to share bad karma, monster elemental cards and dice matching, game end triggers and completion of the round prior to determining a win, playoffs using game win shards, and auto players. This game features the use of karma move and Block Trophy shards and FOUR monster elemental cards to start your collector’s deck!

Roll dice to work with the various monster elemental cards - monsters are the good guys and help you win! Determine how many karma moves you score per roll and collect your karma move shards, or pass on your no-match karma to another player by attempting to block one of three possible move scores to get a blocking trophy! If you get 11 or more karma moves, that triggers the end the game and a winner is determined at the end of that round!

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - just move and block trophy shards to track and build your scores, and of course, Karma Crystal to track your block attempts!

name: Merchants of Magick: A Set a Watch Tale
description:
In Merchants of Magick, which takes place in the "Set a Watch" universe, you are the owner of a magic item shoppe, crafting items and research­ing spells to sell to the Adventurers of the Watch.

Each round, four polyhedral dice are rolled, then you select two of them to craft items or research enchantments for your shoppe. As you craft items and research spells, you start stocking items and earn potions that let you manipulate the dice. Adventurers travel from shoppe to shoppe, so you need to stock the exact items on the order cards in front of you. If you have an item an Adventurer needs, you earn coin — but if you wait too long to fulfill an order, Adventurers will become impatient and visit your competitor next door!

After ten rounds, the player who has earned the most coin wins.
families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina
Series: Set a Watch (Rock Manor Games)

name: The Hobbit: Hunt For The Arkenstone
description:
Embark on an epic quest with Hunt for the Arkenstone, a cooperative board game inspired by the thrilling scenes from The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies.

In this adventure, players assume the roles of the brave members of Thorin Oakenshield's Company, including Dwarves and Hobbits. Working together, they must search the vast lands of Middle-earth to find the legendary Arkenstone and return it to Erebor's throne room.

To succeed, you'll need to explore every corner of Middle-earth, using your character's unique abilities and the support of your allies. Along the way, you’ll discover valuable items to aid in your quest. But beware—Azog and his ruthless Orcs are hot on your trail, determined to stop you at any cost.

Hunt for the Arkenstone is a legendary adventure for Thorin Oakenshield and his Company, brought to life in this complete boxed game. Perfect for any fan of Middle-earth, it offers an immersive experience in a single box.

—description from the publisher

name: Diabelski Krąg
description:
Diabelski KrÄ…g is a tactical game in which (in it's basic version) two players compete to either defend or kill a infantile princess of a fantasy kingdom untill the dawn for 3 nights (time is randomly simulated after each turn). The "good side" are four powerful mages, while the "evil side" are eight demons.

Though tactical, the game is pretty random, since the demons change their statistics every turn due to the changing phases of the moon and stars. Demons can change their status, there are 8 stages of it, from 100% material (they can be hurt and they can fight) to 100% spiritual (they can fight only using psychic attack, but can pass through the walls, etc.). Demons can use fireplaces to move, cast a curse, use pentagrams and holes to hell. Mages can use garlick, Torch of Ithilien's Temple, Ilih's Weed, wand, salt, Magic Book, Elvish Drop, pray and exorcise.

One of the last games by Sfera.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring – Battle in Balin's Tomb
description:
The game takes place over 12 rounds, with one player assuming the role of the Goblins of Moria and the other that of the Fellowship of the Ring.

Turns begin with the Goblin player drawing the number of Goblin cards shown in the rulebook and placing any additional Goblin reinforcements (and possibly the Cave Troll as well) in the appropriate positions, then each miniature can move and attack or attack and move or pass the shift; the Goblin player performs these actions with all of his miniatures and once he has none left, the Fellowship player can finally activate his characters.
Once the movements and attacks have been made with all the miniatures in play, the turn ends and the next turn goes on.

At the end of the 12 game turns the Fellowship player wins if he has at least three characters left alive including Frodo; if instead Frodo is killed but the Fellowship player still has at least 3 characters still alive the result of the game is a tie, while if there are less than 3 Fellowship players alive, the Goblin player wins.

name: Catharsis: Second Edition
description:
Catharsis: Second Edition is a revised and remastered version of the original game. The gameplay is still the same, but we have updated the game majorly with better design, new characters, bosses, roles, powers, artwork, narrative and much more. We took all the feedback our fanbase gave us and made the game vastly better.

Catharsis: Second Edition is a true solo & cooperative board game for players who are heroes trying to stop one of the many corruptions spreading through the lands. The game requires strategy, cooperation, and a touch of luck to succeed as the party fights through traps, monsters, and more. Each game is a different experience as each hero has a deck of powers they draw from, creating unique synergies every playthrough. Moreover, the players must hunt down a boss by progressing through its Boss deck, a unique deck of cards for each boss and randomized for each game. The players must carefully balance using their skills and creeping closer to death with burning through their morale and giving up in despair.

—description from the publisher

name: Freelancers: A Crossroads Game
description:
Congratulations! Humanity is dead! The bad news is that all they left behind is their garbage and a broken gig economy. That's why we need freelancers like you who are ready to take any job, no matter how loathsome. As a freelancer, you will delve into ruins, brave the wilds, and slay the hordes of hideous creatures that litter the dark forgotten corners of the world. All so you can gather loot and return home, ready to blow it all and start over again the next day. It's a lousy gig, so it's perfect for the likes of you.

Freelancers: A Crossroads Game condenses the fantasy RPG campaign experience into a single night of fun and mayhem. Create a character, roll funky dice, and blaze your way through multiple stories set in a world of magic, monsters, and murder. Better yet, no game master is required, as a magical companion app does all the storytelling for you! Immerse yourself in fully-voiced, industry-leading audio as you play. Explore hundreds of branching paths in five highly replayable campaigns. Mix and match a multitude of species and jobs to build your own unique character. Pick up and play, simple rules, low commitment and no prep.

—description from the publisher
families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

name: MON: Anarchy Phantasy Multi Card Game
description:
A card deck that can be used in many ways. Can even be used as dice.

54 cards + 2 rule cards forms a deck of 56 cards. The deck can be used as normal playing cards from 2 to ace + jokers. But also as a Japanese Hanafuda deck (48 cards + 6 jokers). The cards can be used playing Trumps, Dingo, Old Maid and other games also.

You can also battle with the characters. Pick five random cards each and do not show your opponent. The rest of the cards is placed in a “dice pile”. The player who most recently was in a fight (for real!) start. It might be back in preschool? Pick one of your characters and decide if you want to do a physical attack; the sword or a mental attack; the candle. Sword attacks are obviously defended by the shield and candle attacks are defended by the smiley face; humour.

The opponent picks out a character he thinks can defend without knowing the attacking value. Now both player draws a card from the dice pile and add the eyes on the card's die to their value, starting with the attacker. Highest total wins and is placed in front of the winner as a used character that won the battle. Also place the die card under it, it's the price for winning; a new recruit. The defeated character is placed in bottom of the dice pile (face up) and the die card (face down).

For example: player one (Kajsa) gets Lonar, Cadran, Minx, Dag and Moog. She chooses Lonar, one of the most powerful characters in the game and attacks with brains/candle (value 8). Player two (Kalle) chooses to defend with his character with highest humour, but that is still only Silver (5). Kajsa takes the first card in the dice pile which is Ulg. Ulg has however only 1 eye on his T6. 8 + 1 = 9 in mental attack. Kalle draws the next card and gets Donolen who has 5 eyes on the T6. 5 + 5 = 10. Silver wins and is placed in front of Kalle along with Donolen. They are now battle weary and not available until everybody have fought. Kajsa's Lonar is discarded under the dice pile along with Ulg. But defeated cards like Lonar can return as an undead and is placed face up! Ulg is placed face down like all other cards. Kalle wins the battle and starts the next round.

If the numbers are even the result is a tie, place both characters in front of the players, they are also battle weary and not available. However the dice cards are discarded and not won. Continue battling until all characters have fought. If both players have character cards left after everybody has fought, pick them up again and repeat everything. Shuffle the dice pile again and remember to keep the undead face up. The one with the least cards start the next battle. If even use rock-papers-scissors to decide. If an undead gets into your army keep it upside down on your hand. When played it automatically defeats both the opponent and him/herself. Remove the undead from the game after battle. The loser is the player who lost all of his/her cards. If one player has more characters to play than the other those are rested until next round.

Try adding rules like that darker cards have +1 against lighter cards or that same silhouettes can’t fight each other for example.

—description from the publisher

name: Doom Cat
description:
You're a young witch learning the ropes of magic. Unfortunately, your mischievous cat found your spell book and summoned demons!

In Doom Cat, you must learn how to draw sigils. You start with 2 magic circle pages filled with numbered candles. Roll 3 dice and draw a line between 2 of the candles matching two of the dice. The cat steals the other die and knocks over a matching candle, making it unusable in future rounds. The game ends after 14 rounds. Highest score wins. Solo players must score 70 or more points per sigil card to win.

Doom Cat comes with many goal cards that immerse you deeper into the world of sigil magic. Shuffle and play with a few random ones, or play them in order, progressively increasing the difficulty. Each scoring criteria incentivizes emergent beauty, giving each player a unique sigil each time!

—description from the publisher
families: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

name: Dungeon Crusade: Book I – Genesis of Evil
description:
Welcome to the world of Avalon!

Dungeon Crusade is a solo/co-operative, sandbox dungeon crawl. Inspired by the classic age of board games, role-playing games and video games, but fitted with new and fresh mechanics.

In Dungeon Crusade your party will enter an ancient dungeon located beneath a village to stem the tide of evil beleaguering the poor villagers. Each time you visit the dungeon you will have an over arching goal that you need to achieve, but you can also pick up side quests and even some odd jobs from the tavern to further modify your adventure!

6 stalwart Heroes are accompanied by their trusty fetch hound Albus. Each Hero has strengths and weakness' and it is up to you to decide if you will split the party to cover more ground or stick together in case a larger threat presents itself...

In the dungeon you will encounter wandering monsters who move about the board. Beware! These monsters might turn into raiding monsters and make their way to village.

You can mine for minerals to craft enhancements for your weapons. You can seek out and hunt down rare and legendary artifacts. You can send Albus back to the village to get a potion in a pinch.

If your quest is successful then the village celebrates in your honor and throws you a grand feast and presents your party with gifts. You can shop around for new gear from the ever changing marketplace, gamble some gold in the house of chance, visit a temple and pray for assistance and more!

Don't get too comfortable because evil never rests and you'll find yourself back in the dungeon facing tougher challenges but hopefully better armed!

name: INCIPIT
description:
ROLL THE DICE
Roll the dice and let yourself be guided by the images to create your own story. Inside you will find 12 dice with 72 different images.

CONTINUE YOUR STORY
Free your imagination and continue the story. Be inspired by the case and interpret the images to create a UNIQUE story!

DOWNLOAD THE APP
Access the application and choose an INCIPIT to start your story! Join the community, write and share your incipits and rate those of other users.

name: Apocalypso
description:
Only one of you will escape the Island alive. Who will that be? Apocalypso is a fast-paced dice game where players aim to be the last one standing. The game starts with the youngest player and moves clockwise from there. Each player gets to roll the dice up to three times to achieve their desired roll.

This is a fun and exciting party game that requires strategy and luck. With its easy-to-follow rules and quick gameplay, it's a great choice for game night with friends and family.

—description from the publisher

name: Legend of Hexdom
description:
A fantasy roll and write solitaire (but also can be played as a coop or competitive experience) where you explore a world of hexes, adventuring for loot, increasing your stats until you are ready to raid the castles and defeat the bosses.

With different classes, each hero has its own set of powers (and weaknesses).
You can find treasures, gems, relics and gifts to assist you in your journey.

Only needing a pen/marker and three six-sided dice and one of Hexdom maps. Our initial campaign promises more than 250 maps in the starting package and we hope to build a community to expand even further.

—description from the designer

name: Adventure Party: The Role-Playing Party Game
description:
Adventure Party delivers a robust role-playing experience that can be enjoyed within 2 minutes of explanation. In this cooperative guessing game, players take the roles of adventurers in a classic fantasy role-playing world, facing monsters and attempting heroic deeds.

Over the course of 3 Adventure scenarios, the party will work together and collectively attempt to score the most Experience Points possible. Players will take turns, rolling their 20-sided die in secret. Based on how well or poorly they rolled, they will describe what their character does; first outlining their plans and then describing the outcome of their actions.

The goal of which is to provide enough detail so that the GM for that turn can GUESS the number they rolled as closely as possible, earning the entire party Experience Points.

—description from the publisher

name: Home Raiders
description:
Home Raiders is a game played with small scale models. These models represent the combatants that travel from a dimension known as the Inner-space to your very home, in order to battle for the dominance of your space. These fighters are little folk (which means that the scale of the models is actually 1:1) which exist in dimensions parallel to ours, and crash our world in order to thrive in theirs.

The basic game is very easy to grasp, and is a great option for a fast game that takes place in your actual living room coffee table, your office desk, or even around your kitchen sink. It takes no time at all to set up, so you can get your dice rolling in a breeze. If you are an experienced gamer, Home Raiders is a great choice for an improvised gaming session or even a well laid out match amongst a bunch of friends. If you want to play with your younger brothers and sisters, cousins or even your children, you won't find a better option to getting them started with this amazing hobby.

name: House Of Influence
description:
House of Influence takes place in a historical age of diplomacy where influence is everything. Set after a war that has ravaged the lands people thought the golden age of peace had finally arrived. But underneath deceptive smiles the five different houses are still fighting for power and will use any means to become the house at the top: Influential people with unique skills are at the houses’ disposal to win the game. Be it the selfless Martyr who will sacrifice everything to gain influence for their house, the idealistic diplomat and her silver tongue, the valiant general or other powerful roles.
Which house will win? A house that holds honor and valor in high regard or a house preferring the subtle tactics of a cunning Charlatan?

House of Influence is a Team vs Team semi co-op Hidden role game where 3-10 players become members of a majority or minority. But players need to be careful, their allies might not be who you think they are. In order to accumulate the highest influence score in four rounds, the houses have up to 6 different characters at their disposal to manipulate the flow of influence and information.In this turn-based game each player rolls two available characters with their own set of abilities but can only use one to gather influence or information on the other players.

The appeal of House of Influence is the quick pace of the game with easy to understand rules automated and managed by the game app and unidice - the digitized die. Replayability in this Social Deduction game of intrigue and information is guaranteed. The different houses give different advantages to their house members and the characters at their disposal - depending on the flow of the game. This Hidden Role game combines decision making with the fun of rolling a dice console in the shape of a D6.

-description from publisher

name: RPGQuest: Greek Mythology
description:
A very colorful mixture of RPG and Boardgame, this brazilian game is designed for children of ages 8-10 as an introduction to miniature games.

The game has rules for miniature battles between two or more participants. As in most miniatures games, players build an army with the same number of recruiment points (with each miniature having a different point value), then take turns moving and attacking until the opponent's forces are dead, withdrawn, or your pre-determined time limit expires.

The basic game has 7 races and 8 classes to choose from, over 80 paper fold-out miniatures, 2 82x55cm colored maps and dozens of props.

name: RPGQuest: The Knights Templar
description:
A very colorful mixture of RPG and Boardgame, this Brazilian game is designed for children of Ages 8 - 14 as an introduction to miniature games.

The game has rules for miniature battles between two or more participants. As in most miniatures games, players build an army with the same number of recruitment points (with each miniature having a different point value), then take turns moving and attacking until the opponent's forces are dead, withdrawn, or your pre-determined time limit expires.

The basic game has 11 classes to choose from, over 170 paper fold-out miniatures, 2 82x55cm colored maps and dozens of props.

The game is based on the Knights Templar´s history and mythology

name: Stratos: Light in the Darkness
description:
It has been a year since the five tribes of Stratos began their journey - each carving their own path to prosperity in the fabled land of legend. Plentiful resources have begun appearing along fault lines almost as if they were gifts from beings dwelling in the depths below. The people thought the gifts a blessing but they could not have been more wrong...

Stratos: Light in the Darkness plays as both a themed extension to the original 'Stratos' and as a stand-alone 2-player game. Exciting new challenges await, including Monsters which add a co-operative element to the game. When combined with the original, Stratos: Light in the Darkness can be played with up to 7 players!

Stratos: Light in the Darkness has 5 character classes, each serving a distinct function. Characters move from space to space on a tile-based board which can be arranged randomly or according to set maps. Each character can perform up to 2 unique actions per turn with movement being a repeatable action. Available character actions (dependent on class) include Harvest, Travel, Search, Attack, Shoot, Defend, Cast and Use.

Points are awarded by defeating characters, casting unique spells, discovering treasures, hoarding resources, promoting characters, occupying strategic locations and slaying Monsters! The first player to reach a pre-determined number of Prosperity points (default 10) is declared the winner.

Stratos: Light in the Darkness is a product of Board and Tale Games Inc., a Canadian boardgame publisher based in Hamilton, Ontario.

name: Restaurantrepreneur
description:
Your life-long dream of opening your own restaurant will soon become a reality. But first you must work on the menu, hire some staff, find a location, choose some fixtures and fittings and get the word out across the town. You have money in three different accounts at the bank. Use them wisely, or you may run out of money before you’re ready to open.

Play is simultaneous. On each turn, one player rolls all three dice and each player chooses how to the dice rolls on their own scoresheet.

1 die shows which numbered mini game you are playing this turn. If you choose a six for this die, you may pick any of the five games. 1 die shows what number you will use within that mini game and the third die shows the account you will spend money from in the bank.

The five different mini games all work in different ways...
In game 1 you are creating your menu - by adding elements to plates. In game 2 you are interviewing and hiring staff to work in your cafe. Game 3 enables you to choose the location of your restaurant. In game 4, you're able to select the best fixtures and fittings and create your own personal style, while game 5 helps you to get the word out to potential customers in the area.

Completing milestones within each games triggers bonuses - giving you extra turns and possibly creating a cascade of chaining actions. Players can also earn rosettes which give extra points at the end of the game.

Total up each of your mini games and add your rosette bonus to give your final score. Most points wins!

You just need 3 dice and a pen. To play, you write directly onto the placemat.

Any number of players can play the game. Restaurantrepreneur is also ideal for playing online via videoconferencing.

—description from the publisher

name: Monster Maker 5: Sofia's Holy Knights
description: 5th in the Monster Maker card game's main series. This time they tried to make it a little more complicated (monster are differentiated by more than just strength).

name: Cult of the Deep
description:
You are a cultist, trying to establish your faction's rise to power. Fight over rituals and mythical monsters as you seek victory and control of the cult.

				
				
					RolesEach player is given a role that will remain hidden throughout the game, except the High Priest. This role will determine your win condition:

     High Priest - Root out corruption in the cult. Kill all Cabalists, the Heretic, and survive.
     Cabalists - Seek to take control of the cult. Kill the High Priest.
     Faithful - Protect the High Priest from threats to their power. Kill all Cabalists, the Heretic, and the High Priest must survive.
     Heretic - Burn the whole cult to the ground. Kill the entire cult, yourself included if necessary.


				
				
					Extra abilitiesEach player will also be given a:

     Character card that determines their starting health, special ability, and a power symbol that provides an additional way to gain life from the dice.
     Secret sigil card, which gives each cultist a once per game power, will also be given to each player.


				
				
					MechanicsA player will take a turn by first rolling their dice up to 3 times. They then decide where to commit their dice: to rituals to gain altar effects to temporarily empower themselves, finish a ritual in order to gain its powerful effects permanently, stab other cultists, gain life, or give life to other cultists.

If a player is killed, they are not eliminated. Instead, they become a wraith. They will roll dice on their turn still, just less. They cannot commit dice like normal but instead haunt the dice of enemies and allies by giving, replacing, or discarding dice.

-description from designer

name: Crom
description:
Crom is a skirmish game set in the Hyborian Age "...Between the years when the oceans drank Atlantis and the gleaming cities, and the years of the rise of the Sons of Aryas..." that enables players to recreate the stories of Robert E. Howard and similar authors of heroic fantasy.

Crom is designed primarily as a multiplayer game but can be played with two players or even solo if desired.
One or more players will play heroes, Conan and his companions for instance, and one or more of the other players will play the antagonists, Thulsa Doom, minions, monsters etc. The ideal set up would be three Hero players and a single Antagonist player.
Each scenario should be a short, sharp encounter that takes no more than an hour to play, usually much less. These scenarios can be strung together to form a campaign or story.

Character actions and combat are resolved using an initiative card (chit pull) system and dice pool mechanism.  Scenarios introduce special events and action cards.
